website_summaries.verdict: A great price for a sturdy mountain bike tire, but consider upgrading if you do a lot of off-roading.
pros: Features ultra durable steel bead construction
Good traction for trails and pavement
cons: Some buyers received a tire different than the one pictured

customer_reviews.title: Great Value. Might as well...
customer_reviews.text: First, Sasquatch pay full price. I'm giving these 5 starts for an excellent combination of affordability and durability. I've had these for several months now and they still look quite good. Are they particularly special? I don't know. But I know I got them at a comparatively good price and they are doing the job. For those of you that are wondering if these things are so cheap they fall apart immediately or have some deformity, the answer is no. If Sasquatch helped you make a decision or if you enjoyed this review, mark him helpful. Sasquatch likes that.
customer_reviews.author: Sasquatch

customer_reviews.title: Not the right tire
customer_reviews.text: Sad that someone is switching the tires in the package. I took off the zip tie and this is what I find not Schwinn but Innova cheap budget brand tires very thin and flimsy. I gave them a chance and put them on since I already opened them and cant put them back in the small box. I also do not have time to loose and not ride in another week. I work nights so sleep all day. Point is fix this stop selling something then giving us some cheap knock off. I am not the only one this has happened to if you look in the comments there is at least one other.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Whigham

customer_reviews.title: Superb Bike Tire, fits cruiser bike nicely
customer_reviews.text: We got this bike tire after having a ripped tire on our beach cruiser bike. I was a little concerned because from the measurements, it showed that this tire would fit our needs, but from the picture, the shape at the edges of the tire look squared as opposed to a much more rounded fit on our old tire. Not a big deal for most bikes, but we were replacing a tire on a beach cruiser bike that had a fender. Our worries were unfounded however. The tire fit perfectly and doesn't rub against the fender. The tire is thick, high quality, and should last us a very long time and help prevent punctures from thorns etc. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Artoo

customer_reviews.title: Good tire
customer_reviews.text: These offer a lower resistance than my original tires, and my bike is much more pleasant to ride. They are good tires for trails and pavement. I wouldn't downhill or go extreme on these. BTW "Schwinn" is just a name owned by a Chinese megacorp. So you aren't getting a Schwinn tire. You are getting a Chinese abcxyz brand tire. Even the tires at Walmart are Innova brand in Schwinn boxes. This is the exact tire you can buy there.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: I will tell you these are the best tires ever
customer_reviews.text: If you can still get a set of these tires then buy them.I will tell you these are the best tires ever. They are on my e-bike that I travel about forty miles a week so far that's about 160 miles easy and the tires still look new.I run the front at forty pounds and the back at forty five and she rides so much smoother than ever before I never thought you could be this comfy. I highly recommend these tires I just can not imagine another tire being better than these for an e-bike. Feel free to ask me a question.
customer_reviews.author: BRAD STYS

customer_reviews.title: Reduced rolling resistance and are quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my (cheap) original equip mtb type 2.25 with these, bought mainly for the tread and kevlar content. Two observations to note after about 60 miles of street riding,,,, reduced rolling resistance compared to the original's and they are very quiet. The rolling resistance has been reduced to the point I have kicked my 'general' riding gear selection up one step. Hopefully their wear rate is commensurate with my other impressions. One thing to keep in mind is that they are not easy to mount. There is a youtube video on "Mount A Kevlar Bead Folding Tyre". Would recommend watching it if you purchase these.
customer_reviews.author: BJR

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. I cannot belive how fast these wore down. 3 weeks use. Garbage
customer_reviews.author: TheManWithTheMasterPlan

customer_reviews.title: OK, info supplied by Amazon and on the box ...
customer_reviews.text: OK, info supplied by Amazon and on the box itself is a little vague. The tires are actually “Innova” brand. And the size stated on sidewall is 700c x 38. Maximum PSI is 75 lbs. I backed the tires up with Sunlite 700x35-40 tubes and everything when together with no problems. I have another bike that I put a set of Innova’s on 2 years ago and have had no issues. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Use tire change tools.  They're cheap and very helpful.
customer_reviews.text: Has been great so far. It comes rolled up, so it takes a little reforming. Use a set of tire change tools to make the process easier. When inflating the tube, go slow and make sure the bead seats properly all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: White Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money. Cheapo, weak tires that wear v away to nothng fast.. They also have deformities.
customer_reviews.text: These are supposed to have a puncture resistant lining but the smallest little thing punctures through these very easily. They also wear down surprisingly fast; these are just your typical cheap, weak tires. They also have deformities. Update after only 4 months of approx 10-15 miles a week these tires we're unusually worn and had to be replaced. Treads worn off with light use because of the cheapo material.
customer_reviews.author: CDW

customer_reviews.title: cheap and durable, but old technology
customer_reviews.text: Put this on a 15 year old mountain bike. Works fine. But today most bikes come with wider higher volume tires, not to mention larger diameter like 27.5 or 29'ers. These new bikes just handle far better IMO. A friend put some newer design wider tires on his 26 rims and I was impressed. I'm ordering some 2.3" wide Continentals for that bike instead of these. My frame can take them. Times have moved on.
customer_reviews.author: Count Orloff

customer_reviews.title: Fit Perfect. Easy to Replace.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8 year old daughters bike. It fit perfectly and was easy to install. Just a little tip, go ahead and replace the tube while your at it. You already have the tire off so might as well. I tried to be cheap and use the old tube. Got it all back together and the tube was bad. So i had to take it all back apart, get a new tube and put it back together. Another tip I might add is to put just a little bit of air in the tube when mounting the new tire. It makes it way easier to fit and adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Innova tire, not Schwinn.
customer_reviews.text: The tire came in a Schwinn box but it is an Innova tire, not a Schwinn tire. My previous review got rejected for some odd reason. So I am trying one sentence at a time.
customer_reviews.author: A. K. Kaw

customer_reviews.title: Nice but Heavy
customer_reviews.text: The tires look great and have a more rounded shape than the photos show, although not as much as most bike tires. They went on easily and the steel bead was no problem although it required considerably more effort than a Kevlar bead. If you are experienced you probably won't mind. They are so heavy that I weighed them. They are over 2.5 lbs each. That's over 1.5 lbs MORE than the tires they replaced. No wonder other reviewers like them on their electric bikes. For a cruiser bike, that doesn't seem to be a big problem either. They ride great and feel great. If you don't mind the weight then I say they are a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Bait & Switch?  Received Innova brand tire.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these direct from Amazon. The box shows Schwinn "All-Terrain Tire" with "Flat Tire Protection" and "Puncture Guard". The box says nothing about kevlar at all. The tread is nothing like the photo of the product. The bottom of the box shows "Item #: SW75850-2". Upon opening it, instead of Schwinn, it's an Innova brand with the model number IA-2003-10. The size is a 26x1.95 Again, it says nothing about kevlar and doesn't even say anything about flat tire protection. This Innova tire may or may not be a good tire, but I don't know. I think it's quite a bit misleading to put a different tire in the box. Both boxes had the same Innova tire.
customer_reviews.author: Banzai!

customer_reviews.title: This tire is amazing. I bent the Snot out of my rear ...
customer_reviews.text: This tire is amazing. I bent the Snot out of my rear rim and to my astonishment, the tire did not go flat nor did it break a bead. On another occasion I ran over what appeared to be a very large steel exacto blade sticking through my tire,.. from the bottom tread and was pushed out the sidewall,.. the tire did not go flat. I have 800 miles on this tire and I expect another 300 miles before I change it out. I ride mostly road surface and dirt trail.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These tires just haven't stood up to the harsh environment like my previous tires
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these tires in January 2018 and have run them for 1,500 miles in six months. I've had five flats (punctures and cuts) in that short amount of time and also notice the tread wear is excessive, at least compared to my previous tires. Maybe they're a soft rubber. I ride asphalted gravel roads mainly and there are lots of small rocks. These tires just haven't stood up to the harsh environment like my previous tires. I'm definitely not a fan of these tires and will go to something different soon.
customer_reviews.author: JC22

customer_reviews.title: Great looking tires with excellent puncture protection!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has an older Huffy beach cruiser bike. The tires had become dry rotted and very susceptible to thorns and punctures. Not only are these lined with Kevlar (which has completely stopped flats for her), but I really love that this is a flat tire bike. I love the look it gives the bike, and for the few times I ride her bike, it seems smoother to me. Much more contact with the road, but an overall smoother ride. Seems to be much more structural. I'm a bigger guy, and regular tires smoosh out to be flatter anyways, so why not start with something designed more like a car tire.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lamont

customer_reviews.title: They are not schwin kelvar tires they fool you
customer_reviews.text: 20 bucks is ok price for tires no wonder they not kevlar they innova tires in a schwinn box do not buy i didnt return them i needed them asap
customer_reviews.author: Erwin

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to get on and off the wheel
customer_reviews.text: This tire is the work of ten Hercules to get on and off the wheel. Took me 40 minutes of struggling with it yesterday. It's such a tight fit I'm repeatedly pinching holes into inner tubes changing them, and in 40 years of changing flat tires I've NEVER had that problem before - using standard tire irons.
customer_reviews.author: Dora A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Even if it says it's "Schwinn" doesn't mean it's Schwinn!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my wife's Schwinn Super Sport touring bicycle from the 1970's and they were supposed to be the size indicated (1-1/4" X 27" ) for this particular bike. Unfortunately, they were oversized and blew off the rims and destroyed two tubes in the process. I had to give-up and take it to a bike shop to buy different tires and tubes because these weren't right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tire. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is an Inova tire. I put it on my mtn bike with a rear hub motor and heavy sla batteries. So far it is doing it's job just fine. I had no problems mounting it and it looks and rides nice. I ride on the streets but I wouldn't hesitate to take it off road. It probably won't do so well in the mud and snow but it's not designed to. I will probably put one on my other bike too.
customer_reviews.author: Buzyrd

customer_reviews.title: Just installed
customer_reviews.text: Tires had very good reviews, so I gave them a try and I was not disappointed. The arrived boxed and tied together with a heavy zip tie, so I unboxed and removed the zip ties and let them sit for a few days. Installed them today very easily. They did seem just a bit narrower than my old tires, but that could be because my old ones were worn out. Anyway, the ride is great! And I love the fact they have a layer of Kevlar under the tread to resist punctures. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Great for street ride
customer_reviews.text: Use it on my mountain bike, now i do not take it off road but just use it to go to and from work. It has a lower profile than the one i had so it optimizes my ride as on the road i do not need that much friction. Have been using it for a couple of weeks and so far they have been great. I even got them with an amazon discount so could not be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Xavier Ordenana

customer_reviews.title: Not the tire I bought
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tire that was advertised, but got a completely different one. The main reason I bought this tire was because it "has a traction pattern suited for road and trail riding", as advertised. However, I received a tire that has a completely different traction pattern from the one on the Amazon photo, definitely not suited for trail riding. Also, tire didn't come in a Schwinn box, as shown in the picture. Complete disappointment. Only giving two stars because I got a tire in the end and need one to replace my currently worn tire.
customer_reviews.author: Malu Guia

customer_reviews.title: Good quality tire by Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: Good quality tire. Installed easily and holding up well. Some reviewers seem to not understand that just about every major brand sources its products from somewhere (yes, usually a factory in China), but if they control specifications and quality it doesn't matter what name is on the fine print on the sidewall. In this case, Schwinn takes full responsibility, as they should, and have done a nice job supplying a cost effective high quality MTB tire. We're entirely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Nichiyoubi

customer_reviews.title: Works great on my rubbermaid cart
customer_reviews.text: I liked that I was able to use this tire on my rubbermaid cart and not spend 3 times as much for an OEM part. Installed it without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: busboy

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement tire for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent replacement tire for 20" bike. The tires that come with most bikes today are made of a very soft compound rubber and start to show signs of wear after 25 miles of regular use. These are a much better tire and will last alot longer! The tread on this tire is not really aggressive. It is great for the road or dry trail riding. It would not be suited for mud or loose dirt. Great everyday tire for boys or girls bikes!
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye44446

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I Put these on my Mongoose 29 inch bike. - they showed up on time, installed well (not like a cheap tire ) - and ride like a dream. took them out on the grass and dirt a couple times now, and they are holding up fine. (previously tried 29 x 2.0_ from a bike shop ) and did not fit- too tall after inflation and would snag my rear fork (mud deflector ) - however these here on Amazon worked perfect. !
customer_reviews.author: C. CALLAWAY

customer_reviews.title: So far so good and glad I replaced my Schwinn Cruiser Delmar 26" ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good and glad I replaced my Schwinn Cruiser Delmar 26" with these recommended ones. The only reason I did not give 5 stars was because the tire(s) did not come with whitewalls. My bike is so pretty with the whitewalls. I am 65 years old and I am learning the hard way trying to repair and replace tires and tubes. Unless you had problems with the original tires I suggest you get as close to that as possible. While not the same make the treads are the same and riding smooth.
customer_reviews.author: fury5love

customer_reviews.title: Purchased used from Amazon, Missing part of Kevlar bead
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking tire. However when I mounted it, and filled it with air, it popped off the rim and the tube was sticking out. Remounted it a second time, and the same thing happened. Looked closely at the tire, and noticed about a 6 inch section of the Kevlar bead was missing from the side of the tire. No wonder it wouldn't clinch onto the rim properly. I bought it used from Amazon, and will not be buying any more used items from them. Items should be checked over better before resold. Now I have a tire that is useless to me, and I can't return it. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Hingst

customer_reviews.title: Work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these were easy to install and look great. I use them on a bike that I ride on largely paved surfaces. They ride well and seem to grip well. I followed some advice on one of these reviews and let them sit in the sun after opening them up for a 15 minutes to help them re-shape to their round form. They are folded into the carton thanks to the kevlar belts.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice tires
customer_reviews.text: I ditched the knobby mountain bike tires from my bike and gave these a try. The quality is great and the tread is exactly what I was looking for - a smoother tread for pavement, light gravel and general commuting. I had a bit of difficulty putting these on as I was used to the tires that have a more stiff edge. I took them to my local bike shop and they put them on the rims in literally 10 seconds (free of course). I'm sure I'll get plenty of use out of these.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A. Shabino

customer_reviews.title: good so far
customer_reviews.text: I got these to replace my dry-rotted Kendas. They seem to be of similar quality. I've only tried them on pavement so far. The ride is very smooth. They do say "Maed in China" , but it's spelled "Made" elsewhere on the tire. This is the exact same tire being sold at big box store. I'll update on longevity later, but I'm confident they'll last me awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Philo Smith

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT FIT - causes pinch flats if you're strong enough to mount them
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as spares for a cycling trip and didn't mount them until October well past the return date - took an extraordinary effort to mount these too small for 26" rims and unfortunately after two pinch flats I had to give up using these. Be careful buying these as many have said the box says Schwinn but nowhere on the tire is there a Schwinn label - some cheap knockoff named Innova - tires actually feel durable but these advertised 26 x 1.95 DO NOT FIT 26" rims on my Haro MTB without extraordinary effort and then caused two back-to-back pinch flats. Not only lost value of two tires but ruined two new slime tubes.
customer_reviews.author: JM  Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality. Branded Innova on the tire and not Schwinn.
customer_reviews.text: Tires seem to be decent quality. I was replacing 20" x 1.95" tires on a child's bike. I am an avid cyclist and have gone through countless tires through the years. No initial negative warning signs with these. They came packaged well and had no issues mounting on rim. Have been on my daughter's bike for approx. a month an holding air just fine. Only thing to note is that the tires although advertised as Schwinn have Innova branding on both the box and sidewall. Not a big deal for me because it was going on a child's bike but would normally be a little irritated that it wasn't the brand that I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: BradJessica

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy - Not Schwinn tires
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, these are are NOT Schwinn tires, and I doubt they have kevlar. Don't waste your money. Innova brand tires in a Schwinn box. I'll be returning these...
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: Tough, Handles Well
customer_reviews.text: Got a set of these for my beach cruiser after a flat on the stock set. They're heavy. If you're going for a light ride, pass on these. That said, the rubber is thick, making them quite tough and able to resist punctures from most road hazards. The squared design might mess with handling in a steep turn. I had no such problem, and find the handling intuitive on my big and heavy cruiser. The tread is a deep, aggressive design that collects pebbles and debris like you wouldn't believe. They ride very quiet. I've had little road noise while riding on them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: burned out quickly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the tire because of its aggressive tread. That's the only reason I gave it two stars; it "looked" better than many competing tires. And with a known brand name, I assumed the best. However, after about 3 weeks of use, my son has worn this tire completely through and needs another. Now to be fair, my son rides his bike hard and rides the brake like crazy (who doesn't remember slamming on the brakes into a slide when in the second grade?!) Needless to say, I replace a lot of bike tires. Normally, I can relax for a season before he rides through the tire. But this particular tire didn't even last a month.
customer_reviews.author: The P.

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for a worn kids bike
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for a worn kids bike. The box the tire came in said Schwinn but there was no marking of that on the tire itself. The sidewall of the tire said Innova who is probably the supplier for Schwinn to resell but not a big deal to me. The tire seemed well made and didn't have any obvious imperfections. Grip seems good but the tire/bike is too small for me to have any first hand experiences with but time will tell how long this will hold up to the habit of skidding the back tire.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa S.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Amazon search engine led me to wrong size tire.
customer_reviews.text: I have no opinion of these tires, but do wish to warn people that the search engine software in use by Amazon will mislead you to something not even remotely similar to what you type into the search box. I was looking for 26" tires, and guess what Amazon recommended? These 16" tires. So, after paying a penalty fee and shipping them back, I finally managed to find the tires I was searching for - at a non-Amazon retailer. This review is not intended to harm this retailer, but to notify them of this problem and hopefully motivate them to put pressure on Amazon to only show potential customers exactly what they are seeking and noting else.
customer_reviews.author: Common Sense

customer_reviews.title: I got duped! These are not Schwinn Bicycle Tires. Still great!.
customer_reviews.text: These tires are Chinese and not Schwinn. I can't give you a honest review since I just got them yesterday. We'll see what happens in the future. Although they do fit perfectly on my titanium mag rims they're a bitch to get on. They're perfect! My second review. Great value for the money. Course now I also have a Mr. Tuffy tire liner underneath the tire with duct tape over that holding it dead center in place. I think I live in the goat head thorn capital of the world, Tucson Arizona! No flats yet. And that's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Donald L. Wagner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: These tires were advertised as Shwinn tires and were not ...
customer_reviews.text: These tires were advertised as Shwinn tires and were not. They were listed as 26" tires but very undersized and couldn't even begin to get them on the original 26" Shwinn rims. They are made in china junk and I say this was a classic case of bait and switch.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C. Nemitz, Sr.

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: As others have mentioned, these tires do not stay seated in the rim when inflated to the recommended pressure of 70 PSI. Also... not sure if Innova is a Schwinn sub-brand but nowhere on the tire do they say Schwinn (tho they do come in a Schwinn box). Save yourself the headache of installing a tire that is instantly wobbly... purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but not good quality. I won't buy these again. (see 11/24/2019 edit)
customer_reviews.text: These are heap but not good quality. One of them had two chunks of rubber out of it. They obviously have poor quality control at the factory. I am going to use them but I won't buy them again. I'd rather spend a few bucks more for a quality tire. Edit 11/24/2019: After mounting these I can see they wobble, so it's more than just a problem with visible defects in the rubber. I'm returning these and reducing may rating to 1 star. I guess Schwinn just isn't what it used to be. I'm going to stick with Kenda or Sunlite in the future.
customer_reviews.author: GARY

customer_reviews.title: FRAUD
customer_reviews.text: On June 15, 2019 I bought two 24" bike tires advertised on AMAZON as Schwinn bike tires. I received two bike tires with the name INNOVA stamped on the side of the tires, inside of boxes that read Schwinn bike tires. This is nothing but FRAUD. after reading some of the reviews I found out I was not the only one this had happened to. I hope Amazon and Schwinn look into this FRAUD.
customer_reviews.author: JCA

customer_reviews.title: Better to buy a NON FOLDED tire instead of this...
customer_reviews.text: While this has been a fine tire in the riding phase, I'll state that it was simply the most difficult tire I've ever put on. It is quite possible that I've reseated tires more than 100 times in my life. This one ranks as #1 in the MOST DIFFICULT category. I know what I'm doing, so I imagine it would be harder for a casual bicyclist. Seems like a fine tire once it's on, and I suspect the tire will be easier to put on a second time after it has formed to the rim. That said, I'm going to recommend going to the local bike shop and paying for a tire that is NOT FOLDED.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn company label, not reflected on tire or packaging
customer_reviews.text: Tire tread was different than expected, but much better than the OEM tire replaced, with obviously better traction for all surfaces. The tire was a perfect replacement for our child’s mountain-style bike. Kevlar puncture-resistant construction is a plus for our mountain and country location! Durability is unknown, as the tire is still new. Package and tire labels do not reflect Schwinn brand. Construction and appearance are of expected high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive tires for your kids bike.
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement tires for my kid's mountain bike. Cannot comment on milage yet as they are still pretty new. They're affordable though and seem to have pretty good grip on trails and street. We took a trip to switchgrass mountain bike trails in early October here in Kansas and they did a good job for him. Only one hiccup was a nice inch and half thorn puncture while riding but a quick tube patch and we were riding again. The thorn was nasty and would've taken down way more expensive tires as well. So far we are both happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Just received the 700C version and fit the rim perfectly.  No issues and priced very well
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned, this is an Innova tire but looks to be of high quality. I am unsure of the anti-flat functionality as I just mounted it. I also noticed Kevlar and a steel bead being mentioned in the description and assume it is Kevlar as tire shows up folded and did not hold that shape after I cut the wrap holding it together (steel bead should never be folded). Some tires may be Kevlar and others Steel bead (depending on size you purchase). It mounted with no issues and looks really good. At around $20, can't beat on price and performance.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Walmart Tires Advertised as Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as Schwinn but did not see a Schwinn label anywhere on this product and in the instructions. Perhaps Schwinn owns this company but advertise it as its own entity. Made in China. I did not notice at first but these are the exact same tires I was taking off my bike. I bought my Huffy used. Original owner purchased at Walmart. He never replaced the tires. You are basically getting a moderate tire at a fair price. Yes, I would purchase again even knowing that I am getting a generic Walmart tire.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: This a review is for the 24” MTB tire for a kid’s bike. Though the listing said steel bead, I received a folding tire. That said, it’s heavier than the stock Bontrager 24 x 1.95 steel beaded tire it replaced. Partly due to the massive lugs on the tread and partly the compound. The tread pattern is typical of a mud tire so not ideal for hard pack but in this size and especially at this price it’s hard to be too choosy. The amount and density of the rubber is quite pinch and puncture flat resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Mark my Words

customer_reviews.title: As others have said, it's like adding rear suspension to your bike.
customer_reviews.text: There's not as much tread on this, as it looks; it's mostly just the shape of the tire that's been changed. But it really does smooth out the road. It's like adding a much needed rear suspension to my ebike, and at less than $20! I guess it's the added surface area on the tire that reduces impacts. The added surface area also makes it more stable when riding in a straight line, and maybe slightly less stable on fast turns.
customer_reviews.author: marshall

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Except for perhaps for more rolling resistance, I can say that these tires helped me more than the 3X more expensive Continental tires. The expensive tires tore on the sidewall 3 times and I got stuck with them. On these Schwinn tires, I put a thick tube and I had no flats. Tire lasts on an e-bike. I will also add a liner when it finally arrives from China in order to prevent flats. These tires don't feel like they have a lining but I am not 100% sure. Maxxis Tire Hookworm Single Ply 26 x 2.5 Black Steel has much better rolling resistance, comfort and quietness
customer_reviews.author: Leo Savini

customer_reviews.title: Rides and handles like OEM tire.
customer_reviews.text: This tire was to replace original 1991 Cannondale mountain bike rear tire. The side wall failed and has a gapping hole which cause the tube to punctured. I patch the tube and installed this Schwinn replacement tire and fill to about 50 psi. The first thing I notice, the flat profile compare to a typical rounded bike tire. But it handles fine really no difference then the OEM tire. No comment on mileage, durably and longevity- only about 25 miles. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LL-SDGO

customer_reviews.title: Only have a cpl hundred miles on but happy so far
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a bent trike. Only have a cpl hundred miles on but happy so far. They're fairly competent off road and slow on the road compared to the marathon plus I replaced. It was a compromise I was willing to make as my riding is about 70/30 between pavement and off road. Compound is much softer so they corner on the road just as well but hard stops are far superior. No flats so far riding very dirty roads and high desert off. I do run slime tubes but my experience with those on my mnt bike is they're worthless.
customer_reviews.author: B. Plomer

customer_reviews.title: Size seems to be larger than advertised
customer_reviews.text: I know it says it's a 38mm tire...but the one I received was MUCH CLOSER to a 42mm...and as such, it has a 'pretty bad mushroom' over the rim, as a result...luckily, I put these on a beachcomber model bike...so not like it's going through acrobatics all the time... Wouldn't buy this tire again on 38mm...assume it is 'oversized' and order appropriately. My previous tires were Continental 38's...and they were perfectly square-shouldered to the rim...
customer_reviews.author: Melanie C

customer_reviews.title: Great Mud tires for off road/snow
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Son's bike. He rides 10km to school each way--everyday. So, that's 20km or 12 miles of wear a day on a bike tire. Since we get a lot of snow, usually on snow days, it's go pick him up from school, but couple of times the roads had to be closed. These tires were just the thing to fix that. Now my son, even on snow days can get back home (3-4 big up hills between house and school). Also, these tires work great and keep tire puncture/flat tires reduced by 80% vs. regular bike tire. Very pleased with the purchase. Worked exactly or BETTER than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These tires are excellent - I love the tread!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these tires for my kid, in order to replace the minimal-tread tires that came with her bike, and I was VERY pleased with the quality of the product. The difference in tread and traction with these BMX-style tires is massive - wet or dry, on pavement or over grass, these tires grip really well, and I highly recommend these for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTOPHER S MODISETTE

customer_reviews.title: Good budget all weather tires
customer_reviews.text: Very good tires for $14(The amount I paid, they are good tires and could be worth more.) They are good tires if you are on a budget and they are priced right. UPDATE(11/29/18): Having now used them in wet weather, I can say these are good all weather tires, or at least 3 season tires depending on your area. I wouldn't trust them in snow/ice, barring that they handle wet weather great. If you live in a city where vehicular traffic and plows keep the streets just wet(possibly slushy) during the winter, you'll be golden with these.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S.

customer_reviews.title: Best tire I've had on my bike from 3 different tread types
customer_reviews.text: Best tire I've had on my bike from 3 different tread types. I have used these mainly on dirt, sand and loose gravel. For me they seem to dig or scoop better limiting sideways slip rather than rolling across the top of sand, gravel or dirt. I never have had to lock up the brakes and so far have had little tire wear after 100 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Eolian

customer_reviews.title: Solid tires for a hybrid / all-purpose bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought these last year to replace some aged, rotting tires on my wife's Giant hybrid and they've been very good under a variety of conditions (as well as nice and pliable for an easy install). The ride is smoother and grip is much improved, all for a reasonable price. The bike handles well on the road as well as dirt and gravel paths. All in all, a nice cheap upgrade that will add another few years to this bike's lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: AlBSure

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this tire
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this tire. I was able to install it easily (on the front wheel), and the bike responds well with it on there. Quality looks to be on par with other tires I've had on the bike, so that's all good, too. There's really nothing I can complain about, so this one's getting five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Just_Keith

customer_reviews.title: So far, a good cruiser tire
customer_reviews.text: Once I got this tire out of the box and on the back wheel (some care must be taken to get a nice uniform fit), it aired up well, and has held air for months now. I take it on a ride most days across pavement, gravel, rough road, and off road into grass and dirt sometimes on my Huffy cruiser. As with all cruiser tires, it's built to be a little on the heavy side, but has held up good so far...time will tell. Have been using it at least a couple months now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but Durable
customer_reviews.text: I can't say how long these tires will last but the tire quality appears pretty good. Tire installation was pretty easy. One thing to remember while installing the tires that you should be adjusting breaks (both front and rear) after tire install. The tread pattern also seems to be good for breaking and good for both wet/dry surfaces. Pros - * Easy to install Cons - * Tires are bit pricey
customer_reviews.author: G.A.

customer_reviews.title: Avid Bike Riding Son....now not so much
customer_reviews.text: For a few years my son was an avid bike rider. Riding every weekend and always working on his bikes. But he started working fulltime about 18-20 months ago and it leaves him little time for bikeriding......but as far as I know this replacement tire is still on the last bike he rode. It's just not being ridden. So I think it was a good value, a great fit but I cannot tell you about how many miles or how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: CMac

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn is the best
customer_reviews.text: I bough this tires 3+ years ago and still strong. I got one time flat on gravel but after I add flat protection, no more flat. It's very comfortable on pavement and gravel. I put this tires on my electric bike and it's 500+ miles and the thread still good. I will buy this again and I recommend this tires if you want to have comfortable ride for weekend or weekday. Not for racing as the tires are wider and heavy.
customer_reviews.author: HanHan

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been riding the same trail for years. My last pair of tires lasted many years and they were lighter and did not claim to be puncture proof. When they got worn down I bought these as a replacement. They are much heavier and added time and effort to my ride. The worst part is they only lasted a few rides! Today I got a flat and discovered it was caused by a teeny tiny thorn that was probably about 1/8 inch long and really narrow! This tire cannot claim to be puncture proof if such a minuscule thorn gave me a flat. Total waste of money. Zero stars would be my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: great mountain bike conversion tire
customer_reviews.text: Made the old Trek into a road bike. These roll with less resistance, and you don't feel nor hear the knobby vibrations. Easy to install with just your bare hands; only takes about 3 minutes to get it worked around just right, and stretched over the rim. A little more narrow than the off road tires but that's cool. They are not really Schwinn but who cares, as no brands are really true anymore.
customer_reviews.author: jobiwan

customer_reviews.title: Ended up in my trash after 1 ride
customer_reviews.text: The tread pattern is good, and the rubber seems fine. But the beads were way too tight to get on my kid's Trek bike. The wires in the bead ended up snapping and I almost bent the rim with the spoon. I immediately tossed these and bought 'proper' tires (same size) and they went on easily and fit way better. The ones I bought were admittedly much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: John37

customer_reviews.title: NOT SCHWINN TIRES
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT schwinn tires, they are innova tires stuck in a schwinn box, they are extremely soft so i assume they will wear really quick and they don't say kevlar anywhere on them. This is the third item that i bought from the seller amazon.com that was not the same as the product advertised. There is no way to contact amazon.com to ask questions about these products.
customer_reviews.author: ron

customer_reviews.title: Best tires for my bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice tire. Very quiet and smooth. Not hard to put in once you know how. The ply tools are not enough, you may need to use a longer screwdriver to lever the edges into the ring. Now I have peace of mind, because these Kevlar will last. The original tires on my mountain bike is 2.1 inch, this one is 1.95. The numbers may not seem to have a big difference, but the tread are a lot smaller and the tire is smoother. I use the bike to ride on paved roads.
customer_reviews.author: PasWilly

customer_reviews.title: recommend! Quality, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these new tires and got them installed on the bicycle today. They look great, easy to install and seem very high quality. The ride is very nice and smooth as I went for a short ride right away, highly reccommend!
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Heavy construction
customer_reviews.text: I took on the renovations of some old beach cruisers. One of the bikes definitely needed new tires so I searched around and found these. I was afraid they wouldn’t fit (especially after receiving them— they look gigantic). In fact, they did fit and look very nice. I had to have another person help me put them on, however, I probably could have done it myself if I hadn’t been so impatient. They are substantial and should last many years (we just travel around our small island on this).
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: good tire but tricky getting on
customer_reviews.text: never mounted tire like this before but once figured out not hard to do. after removing old tire inflate TUBE about 1/3 to 1/2 full place inside tire then start working both side of tire onto rim at same time. i let a little air out about 2/3rds away round rim then let more out at about last twelve inches(when tire gets hard to install/taught). then mount tire on bike and air tire up.
customer_reviews.author: oldman

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: People we're right when they said these tires are garbage... Definitely DO NOT buy..unless this manufacturer want to discuss replacement tires no good reviews here. I have an electric bike which has a rear hub motor and had to go through the complications of replacing these tires within a month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent tire, not made by Schwinn and very heavy
customer_reviews.text: I placed these tires on my mountain bike which I use for long distance touring. So far I have over 350 miles on them and they have held up well with little wear and no flat tires. They have been used on pavement, dirt, loose rock and crushed stone. The big draw back to these tires is that they are very heavy. The other problem as other reviews have noted is that they are not made by Schwinn. In the future, I will purchase another brand just because of the weight issue. However, for the price, these are a good tire.
customer_reviews.author: M. C.

customer_reviews.title: bought for rubbermaid farm cart
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the tires on my Rubbermaid cart. OEM wheels are like 70.00 apiece. I did some research, but nobody could say if these would fit on the plastic rims of the cart. I decided to give them a try. They fit like the originals. They look like the originals. I changed the bearings ( again I had to find out for myself if that could be done), and now I have a brand new cart for just over half the cost Rubbermaid wanted for one wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hill

customer_reviews.title: Ride On!
customer_reviews.text: These tires fit my need for emergency treads on a summer of biking. When a tire is ruined, I need something to keep me going until I can find the high quality stuff I usually use. These worked better than expected and were even puncture resistant enough to be reliable on some bad terrain and thorny conditions. A little tire sealer helped, but so did the Kevlar. I would buy these for the grandson's bikes for paved and gravel trails they ride. I will replace them for next summer's emergency treads. Ride On!
customer_reviews.author: GR8TREK

customer_reviews.title: Great tires. As most reviews mention
customer_reviews.text: Great tires. As most reviews mention, these were a bit tricky to install but I made sure to unfold them from the packaging and “settle” for a few days before installing. I’ve only done bike tire replacements once prior to this most recent attempt and was able to get these installed correctly without ruining the inner tubes. I definitely used some plastic tire levers to help with he install. Haven’t had a chance to go on a long ride with these but they look very durable and have a smaller profile than my previous 700x38c tires that I’m replacing (likely because the previous tires were really old and had stretch marks across both sidewalks of the tire).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement tire for small bike.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tire to replace a tire worn out by skid marks. We’ve put it thru the paces for a couple of months of hard riding and it’s holding up well. We are also trying to rein in the skid marks which will help extend its life. Anyway, this tire is easy to put on, and is showing only a little wear after quite a few miles. The packaging is a minimal box and a rubber brand. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: D354

customer_reviews.title: great tires
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the price fool you these tires look great and function properly. Don't really notice a difference from what came stock on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: My ratings are in the "middle" (3 stars), cause I don't know the answers yet... mileage, longevity, etc etc.. What I do know is that it is a good looking tire, was easy to install on the bike, thread looks well done, make a long story short.. I am not a bicycle tire specialist, BUT.. I am a totally happy and satisfied customer when it comes to this product.
customer_reviews.author: H. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement, Trust the Sizing!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the tire on a used bike i bought for my son. He has a 20" bike and this fit perfectly. When you receive it you will think this is way to big and this is not the right size but trust me, once you finagle it into place it will fit like a glove. No issues with this tire so far in the several months we've had it on and just as good as new OEM.
customer_reviews.author: JMH

customer_reviews.title: Best cruiser tire I've found
customer_reviews.text: This is the tire. Put my first one on with a slime tube on my Schwinn Meridian e-trike, front hub motor. After 3000 miles, it's still there, never had a flat, tread is almost gone. Rear tires, another story. Original tires had a flat in less than a week. Bought 2 tires that looked just like these from the bike shop, but they ain't the same. Still had flats. Put two of these on the back, no more flats. Ordered 2 more of these for my personal stash. Ain't goin' back! I run them at 40 psi for a good ride.
customer_reviews.author: scalewiz

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these tires in today to swap out my mountain bike knobbies for a smoother quieter ride on pavement... they are nice!! Love the tread pattern design.. a little tough to install.. fantastic instructions have already been given in another review.. definitely gotta work 1 side first, then the other... good pair of tire levers will be needed.. I can't wait to ride on them tomorrow!! Gonna go ride about 50 miles..
customer_reviews.author: Mikebro72

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement brand
customer_reviews.text: Nice affordable replacement for my bike. Can't go wrong with the Schwinn name! Tire was easy to change and seems to ride smoothly. Conclusion: I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tire
customer_reviews.text: I chose this tire based on tread pattern and feedback. I use this on a motorized beach cruiser. I live in upstate NY and this tire is excellent in the snow. And, because of the deep pattern, there is less road spray Even with this pattern, the tire provides a smooth, grippy ride on pavement too.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn tires
customer_reviews.text: great tires! I didn't realize just how bad the old tires were til I put these on! Rides like a dream now! Some reviewers complained that they had trouble getting the tires to seat on the rims. I think that is because of how they fold them up in the shipping box. What I did was lay them out in between the mattress and box spring for a day. That brings them back to shape for placing onto the rim. Mine seated perfectly the first time!. I'm happy! Priced low too!
customer_reviews.author: t-bone

customer_reviews.title: But we found them to be good quality and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These come labelled with a different brand - not Schwinn - as many other reviewers said. But we found them to be good quality and easy to install. Giving three stars for the misrepresentation of the brand. Otherwise seem good so far, but haven't ridden much yet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty, Smooth, Quiet, Kevlar Lined
customer_reviews.text: Very much like the size, Kevlar layer, appearance, & ride of these tires. Ordered 2 at slightly lower sale price, then a 3rd for a spare, intending to use them on a custom e-trike build. Enjoying them on my daily use hybrid mtb. They are noticeably heavier, especially with liners, but roll very quietly at 50psi & grip well. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald M.

customer_reviews.title: NOT Schwinn. Does not last. Flimsy thin. Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Not tough at all. Looks like a direction tire, but no arrow indication on how to properly install tire. Definitely not a Schwinn tire and the tire pattern does not look like the ones in the pictures. Do not buy. I would not trust this tire on long rides in the mountains. Utter trash. A more accurate rating is a zero star rating.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Olivarez

customer_reviews.title: Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Good tires. Arrived quickly. Wear well. I have 800 miles on them already and nipples on the sides are still there. However, next time I will buy tires with the kevlar belt already in the tire. Sometimes a bit of a trick installing the kevlar ribbons in the tire and then getting the inner tube in and having everything remain in its proper place.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Senders

customer_reviews.title: not schwinn branded tires.
customer_reviews.text: The tires are great so far, BUT, after closer inspection of the tire, they are not Schwinn branded tires. The product arrived in a amazon box. The tires were not in the original Schwinn packaging, in fact no packaging was provided. The name on the tire is Innova. I bough the tires with the idea that a puncture resistant tire with Kevlar lining would keep the star thistle at bay. These tires do not specify if they are Kevlar lined. Now they are installed and used a bit, returning them is not an option. I feel ripped off. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: rickydrownsworms

customer_reviews.title: Great all-surface tire
customer_reviews.text: Grippy rubber with a great tread pattern for use on road and dirt surfaces. I put these on my son's 20" Raleigh Rowdy bike to replace the OEM ones when they wore out, and he loves them! Very little tread wear after a few months of riding. I'd recommend them for anyone looking for a versatile, all-surface tire for a BMX or mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: J H

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, good price
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality tires - they were used to replace the cheap blown out tires that came on my EuroMini Campo. So far these have held up very well and are good on the broken up sidewalks, tree roots, sandy patches and grassy areas that I have to ride on during my commute. I would definitely buy them again, but hope that it will be a while before I need to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: A little different
customer_reviews.text: Because they ship these folded over the shoulders are lacking but they mounted fine and look like they will work well. For an old guy like me they are just a bit different than what I have used before. I have no idea how well they will hold up or the mileage but I do know they were a good price and seem to be of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: TMC

customer_reviews.title: Replaced knobby tires for a smoother ride.
customer_reviews.text: After 5 rides the tires seem to be nice. Installation was easy as expected. Smooth ride. The tread does like to catch some earth but I am typically on paved trails. I do not find these tires require extra energy to get going compared to the previous standard knobby MTB tires. Price was good and hopefully they last a while. Happy riding!
customer_reviews.author: T&B

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, hardened puncture proof tires.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, full width tires. These tires are indeed Schwinn brand and they are indeed layered to be puncture proof. If you buy the Kenda thorn resistant inner tubes (also sold here on Amazon) and pair them with these tires you'll never have to worry about a flat tire again.
customer_reviews.author: Ian G. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: THEY ARE NOT PUNCTURE RESISTANT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair specifically to replace my Specialized tires because I was fed up with the constant punctures of the specialized (anything would puncture them). Well in my first week of use with these"Schwinn" I came across my first tiny little thorn (I stay away from grass and rough dirt and weeds, I use my bike mostly in concrete and asphalt), I went through less than 4 feet of grass, and the first tiny little thorn those pieces of garbage found gave me a puncture. I bought them SPECIFICALLY, because they supposedly had "puncture guard". DECEITFUL ADVERTISING!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Gonzalez S

product_meta.title: Schwinn Replacement Bike Tire, Multiple Bike Styles
product_meta.description: The right tire tread is a must for any freestyle biker. The Schwinn Freestyle Bicycle Tire gives you the grip you need to stick all your tricks.
feature_bullets: High traction for riding on various terrain

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
